Home Page Food Panko-Crusted Chicken Bites with Apricot-Mustard Sauce
Panko-Crusted Chicken Bites with Apricot-Mustard Sauce Food Appetizers Boneless chicken breasts Breadcrumbs Cocktail party Lunch Snack Super Bowl party Tapas Email Save Print

Comments ( ) The Martha Stewart Show, February Winter 2007 Yield Serves 12 Add to Shopping List Ingredients
Nonstick cooking spray 1/2 cup all-purpose flour Coarse salt and freshly ground pepper 2 large eggs 1 1/2 cups panko breadcrumbs 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil 1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese Pinch of cayenne pepper 4 large boneless, skinless chicken breast halves (about 2 pounds), cut into 1-inch cubes 1 cup apricot jam or preserves 1/4 cup Dijon mustard 1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme leaves
Directions
Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and fit with a wire rack. Spray with cooking spray; set aside. Place flour in a large bowl and season very generously with salt and pepper. Whisk eggs in another large bowl with 2 tablespoons water until well combined. Place the breadcrumbs in a third large bowl, and drizzle with olive oil; toss to coat. Stir in cheese and cayenne and mix well. Place chicken pieces in the seasoned flour and toss to coat. Working in 3 batches, shake off any excess flour from chicken pieces and transfer to egg mixture; stir to combine. Transfer coated chicken pieces with a slotted spoon to the breadcrumb mixture and toss until completely coated. Place the breaded chicken pieces on a rack-lined baking sheet, spacing them evenly apart. Repeat process until all the chicken is breaded. Bake until golden brown and chicken is cooked through, 18 to 20 minutes. In a small bowl, stir the apricot jam, mustard, and thyme together until combined. Allow chicken to cool 10 minutes before serving with apricot mustard mixture.
Recipe Reviews Review This Recipe Helga22467 9 Feb, 2012 Made this tonight, my husband and I loved it! My 7 yro thought it was ok but her friend loved it! I will make it again! It was easy. Wyndre 31 Jul, 2011 Easy to make and very very yummy! I made it for a babyshower. I can't wait to make it again!! CookNovice 21 Nov, 2010 This is a fantastic chicken recipe! My family can relate to this recipe being for the"the good chicken nuggets"too. The sauce is deliciously sweet and tangy as Pink_bird said. sdavisblue 9 Mar, 2009 Martha and Team, This is by far the BEST chicken nugget recipe I have ever tasted. I only added garlic powder. It was so easy to prep and absolutely delicious, light and fun to make. Lovely for appetizers or entree portion. I can totally see why one other rater stated that her child asks her to make"the good chicken nuggets"because these are fantastic. PiNk_BiRd 23 Feb, 2009 Sweet and tangy are two words to describe. This was an all time hit at the superbowl party! My husbands first reaction to hearing what it was before tasted it was sheer horror but he trusted my cooking instincts and allowed me to do it. I have been asked to make this everytime there is an event. I put cute toothpicks in it for easy handling and to pass around. I would recomend this to anyone! loriben326 1 Jan, 2009 Crunchy, tender, and delicious chicken with wonderful dipping sauce. Made it for a New Year's Eve party and it was a huge hit. Fatouch 19 Nov, 2008 I prepared the Panko-crusted chicken for a New Years party, did not change much except I added hot sauce to spice it up flutterbee 23 Jul, 2008 My 5-year old son who is a picky eater loved this! He calls them"the good chicken nuggets"and requests this dish frequently. This is a great healthy alternative to fast-food restaurant versions and packs well in lunches. buzzme 24 Apr, 2008 I had some chicken and just bought some panko and wanted to use them. Saw this recipe and it was fabulous. Even my husband who thought sauce sounded to sweet was delicious. I will make this alot now. He and I both loved it. katlee 5 Mar, 2008 This recipe is perfect! It has been a huge hit at several parties...everyone loves it. You can prepare the chicken the night before and refrigerate it until you are ready to bake it. I stored it in a disposable tin with wax paper between the layers. mmsrjs 19 Feb, 2008 THIS IS GOOD, EXCEPT I MADE MY OWN BREAD CRUMBS.
